name: ImageMagick API
tagline: Modify images from anywhere via a super simple API
body:
_**ImageMagicAPI.com is not associated with ImageMagick Studio LLC - the makers of the ImageMagick tools - in any way**_

- - - -

# Accepts multiple formats

Input files can be specified as base64 encoded strings or as an external URL

# Common tasks are wrapped in helpers

## /resize

##### Arguments

name | type | description | required?
---- | ---- | ----------- | ---------
input | base64 encoded string OR URI | the input file | Y
width | integer | the output width | you must specify either _width_ or _height_ (or both)
height | integer | the output height | see _width_
quality | decimal | output quality | N
srcFormat | string | format of input file (e.g. JPG) | N
format | string | format of output file (e.g. PNG) | N
progressive | boolean | | N
strip | boolean | | N
filter | string | | N
sharpening | decimal | | N

##### Example
```
POST /resize HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json
Content-Length: 207
Content-Type: application/json
{
    "width": "100",
    "height": "100",
    "quality": 0.8,
    "srcFormat": "jpg",
    "format": "png",
    "progressive": false,
    "strip": true,
    "filter": "Lagrange",
    "sharpening": 0.2,
    "input": "iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAIAAAACACAYAAADDPmHLAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAAlwSFlzAAALEwAACxMBAJqcGA"
}
```


### Direct access to ImageMagick via HTTP

Access ImageMagick command line tools simply:

`montage -background '#336699' -geometry +4+4 rose.jpg red-ball.png montage.jpg`

is recreated like:

```
POST /motage HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json
Content-Length: 133
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "args": "-background #336699 -geometry +4+4",
    "input": [
        "iVBORw0KGgo...",
        "NSUhEUgAAAI...",
        "ADDPmHLEUgA..."
    ]
}
```
